job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in New York, NY
pros: You are hired full time and you get all the great benefits of 1199. I started here in 2016 at $17.16 an hour and this year we got a raise to $17.76. You also get a 10% differential if you work evening or night shift. It's a good job to gain experience if nursing is something you really want to pursue.
cons: Not much over time offered, so I feel like I still need an additional job to support myself.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in New York, NY
pros: They’re always in need of staff, so overtime is readily available
cons: Pay is not enough for the amount of work. They want to replace all direct hire staff with agency workers and yet we are constantly short staffed. Management doesn’t seem to care about the staffing issues or the retention rate. They don’t offer any incentives or even a simple thank you for working like this in the past 3 years of covid.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY

review_title: Things may get better, but right now it's rocky.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in New York, NY
pros: The union benefits are great and there's reasonable schedule accommodation
cons: Change in administration has made the work environment tense. This new administration is much better than the last when it comes to providing order but is very disconnected from employee needs at least in the nursing department. They don't care to listen to concerns, they just bark orders and expect results no matter what. This wouldn't be a problem if we had more staff and we would if they wouldn't be so quick to threaten employees with disciplinary action.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Some of the best times at Isabella were knowing every day I made a difference in someone's life .I learned so much everyday the room for growth was so amazing to me a lot of residents didn't have family so we were there family as well as ours I love how amazing the human body  is so unpredictable and with the right care it can fight till the end.
cons:
Oh boy the downside is seeing a resident giving up can't fight no more can't eat loose sense of e
When to go to bathroom watching someone you became close with pass it was and will always be the hardest part of my job.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY
pros: Union job,  parking is cheap,  union benefits, good and friendly Co workers,  they will hire new graduates ,  compare to other nursing homes they give two month orientation for nurses.
cons: Work load is very high,  no growth, supervisors are okay but they won't help just walk around, you have to beg for your vacation time it's like they are showing you some mercy by giving days off,

job_title: Home Health Aide in New York, NY
pros: They have provided me with opportunities that best matched my skill set. I would recommend working with this firm to others.
cons: I have no cons to report on this company.  I have been very satisfied working with this group and company.

pros: Excellent progressive organization. Good benefit package. High expectations from administration.
